prac02_ex3
Class SuperHuman

java.lang.Object
  prac02_ex3.SuperHero
      prac02_ex3.SuperHuman
All Implemented Interfaces:
Hero
public class SuperHuman
extends SuperHero

A superhuman is born with "powers and abilities far beyond those of mortal men" (e.g., the Amazonian Wonder Woman) but usually adopts a mild-mannered secret identity (e.g., "Diana Prince"). However, under certain circumstances a superhuman may lose some of their powers (e.g., when Superman is exposed to kryptonite), may later regain lost ones, or may acquire entirely new powers.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Colin Fidge

Constructor Detail

SuperHuman

public SuperHuman(java.lang.String realName,
                  java.lang.String secretIdentity,
                  SuperPower[] innatePowers)
When born a superhuman has a real (super) name and later adopts a secret (non-super) identity. A superhuman also has a collection of innate superpowers at birth. If the given collection of superpowers contains duplicates the unnecessary ones are ignored.

Parameters:
realName - the superhuman's true identity
secretIdentity - the superhuman's adopted identity
innatePowers - the superhuman's original superpowers
Method Detail

totalPower

public int totalPower()
Description copied from class: SuperHero
Returns the superhero's current "total power" which is the sum of the numerical values associated with all of his/her currently-held powers.

Specified by:
totalPower in class SuperHero
Returns:
the numerical sum of the superhero's current powers

hasPower

public boolean hasPower(SuperPower queriedPower)
Description copied from class: SuperHero
Tests to see whether or not the superhero currently has the queried superpower.

Specified by:
hasPower in class SuperHero
Parameters:
queriedPower - the superpower in question
Returns:
true iff the superhero currently has this power

acquirePowers

public void acquirePowers(SuperPower[] newPowers)
Adds the given collection of new superpowers to those already possessed. No action is taken for powers already owned by the superhero, i.e., a superhero can't have the same superpower twice.

Parameters:
newPowers - the new powers to be added, if not already owned

losePowers

public void losePowers(SuperPower[] oldPowers)
Removes the given collection of superpowers from those possessed by the superhero. No action is taken for powers not currently owned by the superhero, i.e., you can't take away a power that the hero doesn't have.

Parameters:
oldPowers - the existing powers to be retracted, if currently possessed
